definition: (try to) overcome (hardships etc)/to conquer/to put up with/to endure
variant of 克[ke4]/to subdue/to overthrow/to restrain
Ke (c. 2000 BC), seventh of the legendary Flame Emperors, 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
abbr. for 克羅地亞|克罗地亚[Ke4 luo2 di4 ya4], Croatia/(Tw) abbr. for 克羅埃西亞|克罗埃西亚[Ke4 luo2 ai1 xi1 ya4], Croatia

clothes/dress/garment/to serve (in the military, a prison sentence etc)/to obey/to be convinced (by an argument)/to convince/to admire/to acclimatize/to take (medicine)/mourning clothes/to wear mourning clothes

sentences.english: We have the power and ability to overcome any obstacle in our path.
sentences.chinese: 我们有力量和能力去克服路途上的一切障碍。

sentences.english: The key to following your heart is to learn to deal with fear.
sentences.chinese: 要做到心随所愿，秘诀在于学会克服恐惧。

sentences.english: Most people come to Toastmasters to overcome their fear of public speaking.
sentences.chinese: 许多人到宴会主持人之家来克服他们害怕演说的问题。

sentences.english: The kep overcomes the defect that the original door has low coefficient of a safety tool.
sentences.chinese: 克服了原有门安全工具系数小的缺点。

sentences.english: Houmpheng says the Chinese-built railway can help the country overcome its isolation.
sentences.chinese: 洪屏说中国建造的铁路能帮助国家克服封闭。

sentences.english: Knowing that these thoughts are there is an important first stage in overcoming attention-seeking behaviour.
sentences.chinese: 要克服注意力寻求的行为第一步是觉察这类的想法。

sentences.english: He overcomes the odds and defeats the unscrupulous enemy.
sentences.chinese: 他克服了重重困难，最终战胜了疯狂的敌人。

sentences.english: How to overcome the SRC (Self-Reference Criterion)?
sentences.chinese: 如何克服自我参照标准？

sentences.english: The way to over come nervousness is to breathe in deep and breathe out slowly for some times.
sentences.chinese: 克服紧张的办法是调匀呼吸，深吸气，慢呼出。

sentences.english: As you go up a mountain, you have to overcome the earth's gravity which pulls you down.
sentences.chinese: 上山时你必须克服把你往下拉的地球引力。

sentences.english: At first she shivered from her fear but at last she could vanquish it.
sentences.chinese: 起初她因害怕而颤抖，但最后终于能克服它。

sentences.english: To overcome this solid steel billets were turned in the center lathe.
sentences.chinese: 为了克服这一坚实的钢片被拒绝的中心车床。

sentences.english: Read some of the excellent books on stage fright.
sentences.chinese: 读几本克服怯场情绪的好书。

sentences.english: First, however, there are huge logistical obstacles to overcome.
sentences.chinese: 不过，这首先要克服巨大的物流障碍。

sentences.english: In this paper, the STEP/IGES conversion tool of surface model based on AP203 is presented.
sentences.chinese: 作者提出利用转换工具来克服这种障碍。

sentences.english: If only the leaders would put their heads together we might find a way out of our difficulties.
sentences.chinese: 只要领导人群策群力，我们会找到克服困难的办法的。

definition: to settle (a dispute)/to resolve/to solve/to dispose of/to dispatch
setback/reverse/check/defeat/frustration/disappointment/to frustrate/to discourage/to set sb back/to blunt/to subdue
to break away from/to cast off (old ideas etc)/to get rid of/to break away (from)/to break out (of)/to free oneself from/to extricate oneself
